title: website: play.golang.org post's 403ing
body:
Please answer these questions before submitting your issue. Thanks!

1. What version of Go are you using (`go version`)?
go version g1.6 darwin/amd64

2. What operating system and processor architecture are you using (`go env`)?
darwin/amd64

3. What did you do?
I went to http://play.golang.org/p/YMf_UBvDsH

4. What did you expect to see?
A shared post

5. What did you see instead?
Forbidden

I was having a chat with the chaps on #go-nuts, they suspect that the /28 IP range we switched too last night might appear to be from the PRC or something - it's not, it's Brisbane Australia (poke all the fun you like, but some of us actually have internet)

I can visit http://play.golang.org and play as much as I like, but the share button is missing and if I try to view other peoples posts then I get 403 Forbidden.

The IP I'm coming from is 103.58.192.211 (we actually have the whole 103.58.192.0/22), there are no proxies at this end.
